intro: Coronopus leptocarpus, commonly known as the slender-fruited coronopus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its fruits are slender and ribbed, contributing to its common name, while its delicate appearance makes it a notable species in botanical studies.
